links.title: Stocks Are Mixed After Monday's Selloff
links.description: Tuesday's trading reflected a concern about a growing wave of coronavirus cases in the U.S. and Western Europe. Stocks and sectors seen as most insulated from the pandemic and stay-at-home orders outperformed those more sensitive to an economic recovery. Growth-oriented technology, communication services, and consumer discretionary sectors of the S&P 500 rose, as did the defensive utilities and health care groups.

links.title: Eli Lilly (LLY) Q3 Earnings And Revenues Miss Estimates
links.description: Eli Lilly ( LLY - Free Report) came out with quarterly earnings of $1.54 per share, missing the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $1.76 per share. This compares to earnings of $1.48 per share a year ago. These figures are adjusted for non-recurring items. This quarterly report represents an earnings surprise of -12.50%.

$REGN $LLY 

Other studies involving Eli Lilly’s antibody treatment are continuing to move forward, including another one sponsored by the National Institutes of Health that involves recently diagnosed Covid-19 patients who have mild to moderate cases of the disease. Lilly also is running a trial to see if the antibody treatment is effective on a preventative basis for residents and staff at nursing homes.

The company has so far seen “strong results” from the antibody studies that involve patients who are earlier in their Covid-19 diagnoses, Ricks said. “Catching the disease early, where you can reduce the viral load with an antibody, appears to be making a significant difference.”

By the time a patient ends up in the hospital, Ricks said, there may “not be enough viral load left to reduce” with an antibody treatment. “Instead, we might want to use anti-inflammatory drugs like steroids or our own

https://finance.yahoo.com/news/chromadex-pops-28-anti-ageing-083021883.html

links.title: ChromaDex Pops 28% On Anti-Ageing Supplement Covid-19 Study
links.description: Shares of ChromaDex Corp. jumped 27.5% on Tuesday after the biotech company reported some positive data from its COVID-19 Phase 2 study that involves its nicotinamide riboside (NR) - an anti-ageing supplement.ChromaDex (CDXC) said that the Phase 2 trial showed that patients with mild-to-moderate COVID-19 "experienced a 29% reduction in recovery time when receiving the standard of care in combination with a nutritional protocol including nicotinamide riboside (NR)."

links.title: Stocks Will Try To Advance On October 27
links.description: Stocks are rising on October 27, with the S&P 500 ETF trading higher by around 50 bps, making up for some of yesterday's drop. The best thing that could happen today for the market is an early gap-fill lower after the open and then a steady grind higher for the day's balance.
